intro: Alvaradoa amorphoides subsp. amorphoides, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, vine-like stems and trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of violet or blue. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within its native habitat.
